intro: Carduncellus araneosus f. intercedens, commonly known as the spider-thorn or spider-thorn fig, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the Moraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, thorn-like structures that resemble spider legs, giving it its common name. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually small and hairy, while its fruit is a small, fleshy, edible drupe. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
